title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: In these Regulations -
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations - 

“applicable period” means the period beginning on 1 March 2020 and 
ending on 30 June 2020; 

“Principal Regulations” means the Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) 
Regulations 2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006).
text_norm: 2 regulation - applicable period mean period beginning 1 march 2020 ending 30 june 2020 principal regulation mean road traffic (licensing drivers) regulation 2006 (s.i no 537 2006)

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: 3. Where a certificate of competency issued under Regulation 24 of the
text_raw:
3. Where a certificate of competency issued under Regulation 24 of the 
Principal Regulations ceases to be valid, in accordance with paragraph (3) of that 
Regulation, on a date during the applicable period, then the period of validity of 
the certificate is extended by 4 months and the certificate thus ceases to be valid 
2 years and 4 months after the date of issue. 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
“Iris Oifigiúil” of 14th April, 2020. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 [126] 3 

GIVEN under the Official Seal of the Minister for Transport, 
Tourism and Sport, 
9 April, 2020. 

SHANE ROSS, 

Minister for Transport, Tourism 
and Sport. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [126]

title: Administration and Ministerial Functions) Order 2002 (S.I. No. 298 of 2002) (as
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations amend the Road Traffic (Licensing of Drivers) Regulations 
2006 (S.I. No. 537 of 2006) to provide that a certificate of competency, issued 
after the passing of a driving test, that expires during the period beginning on the 
1 March 2020 and ending on 30 June 2020 is extended by 4 months. The 
certificate thus ceases to be valid 2 years and 4 months after the date of issue. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [126] 5
